squidpony.squidai

Class CellRepeat

  • java.lang.Object
    • squidpony.squidai.CellRepeat

  • public class CellRepeat
extends Object
    A small struct-like class for determining how to repeat a cell for area of effect purposes. Created by Tommy Ettinger on 5/8/2015.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static CellRepeat DEFAULT
      Every CellRepeat created with the parameter-less constructor is identical, so unless you alter DEFAULT, you can use this field instead of constructing new CellRepeat-s for every cell in a pattern.
      static CellRepeat DEFAULT_AOE
      Area of Effect patterns don't usually need 4-way rotation around the center of their effect, and this otherwise will act like the default constructor.
      static int EXPAND_CHEBYSHEV
      Constant for cells that flood-fill outward to a maximum Chebyshev (8-way equal weight) distance given by length.
      static int EXPAND_MANHATTAN
      Constant for cells that flood-fill outward to a maximum Manhattan (4-way) distance given by length.
      static int FREE
      Constant for cells that repeat moving in the same pattern as they did originally, but can change direction any number of times along that path, and will choose from the set of all possible options at that point.
      int kind
      This should equal one of the five constants in this class for repeat type: SINGLE, LINE, EXPAND_MANHATTAN, EXPAND_CHEBYSHEV, or FREE.
      int length
      The maximum number of times to repeat the travel of the cell.
      static int LINE
      Constant for cells that repeat in a straight line, moving the same distance from the last point in the line as the first cell moved from the start position.
      boolean rotate
      Defines whether all four N/S/E/W rotations should be considered as viable patterns for this CellRepeat.
      static int SINGLE
      Constant for non-repeating cells.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CellRepeat()
      Creates a new CellRepeat with the default values (rotate=true, kind=SINGLE, length=1).
      CellRepeat(int kind, int length)
      Creates a new CellRepeat with the supplied values for kind and length, but rotate set to the default (true).
      CellRepeat(int kind, int length, boolean rotate)
      Creates a new CellRepeat with the supplied values for kind, length, and rotate.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • SINGLE

        public static final int SINGLE
        Constant for non-repeating cells.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LINE

        public static final int LINE
        Constant for cells that repeat in a straight line, moving the same distance from the last point in the line as the first cell moved from the start position.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXPAND_MANHATTAN

        public static final int EXPAND_MANHATTAN
        Constant for cells that flood-fill outward to a maximum Manhattan (4-way) distance given by length. Usually only one of these cells is needed for explosion effects.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXPAND_CHEBYSHEV

        public static final int EXPAND_CHEBYSHEV
        Constant for cells that flood-fill outward to a maximum Chebyshev (8-way equal weight) distance given by length. Usually only one of these cells is needed for explosion effects.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • FREE

        public static final int FREE
        Constant for cells that repeat moving in the same pattern as they did originally, but can change direction any number of times along that path, and will choose from the set of all possible options at that point. An example is the Knight's Tour chess problem, which could get a collection of all possible paths in a certain number of moves by setting rotate to true, kind to FREE, and length to the desired number of moves, for the two mirror-image moves that the Knight could take.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • rotate

        public boolean rotate
        Defines whether all four N/S/E/W rotations should be considered as viable patterns for this CellRepeat. Unless you're making some chess-like game where north is fundamentally different from west and some movement can only be done in one direction of the four (as is the case for Pawn movement), this should probably stay true (the default).

      • kind

        public int kind
        This should equal one of the five constants in this class for repeat type: SINGLE, LINE, EXPAND_MANHATTAN, EXPAND_CHEBYSHEV, or FREE.

      • length

        public int length
        The maximum number of times to repeat the travel of the cell. Ignored for kind=SINGLE, used as radius for the two EXPAND_ kinds, and the limit on iteration for FREE. If length is too high for FREE mode, you should expect stack overflow errors, so don't try an unlimited free movement.

      • DEFAULT

        public static final CellRepeat DEFAULT
        Every CellRepeat created with the parameter-less constructor is identical, so unless you alter DEFAULT, you can use this field instead of constructing new CellRepeat-s for every cell in a pattern.

      • DEFAULT_AOE

        public static final CellRepeat DEFAULT_AOE
        Area of Effect patterns don't usually need 4-way rotation around the center of their effect, and this otherwise will act like the default constructor. You can use this field instead of constructing new CellRepeat-s for every cell in a pattern.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CellRepeat

        public CellRepeat()
        Creates a new CellRepeat with the default values (rotate=true, kind=SINGLE, length=1).

      • CellRepeat

        public CellRepeat(int kind,
                  int length)
        Creates a new CellRepeat with the supplied values for kind and length, but rotate set to the default (true).

      • CellRepeat

        public CellRepeat(int kind,
                  int length,
                  boolean rotate)
        Creates a new CellRepeat with the supplied values for kind, length, and rotate.
